DOC.brief_summary: Background Excessive Crying ( Infantile Colic ) one common complaint parent seek treatment . These otherwise healthy well fed infant show sign failure thrive , cry without identifiable cause , fuss lot hard-to-soothe . Objective To explore feasibility run Randomised Controlled Trial ( RCT ) investigate effectiveness cranial osteopathy addition usual National Health Service ( NHS ) care infant colic . Methods Pragmatic randomise control trial , involve United Kingdom ( UK ) osteopaths private practice NHS health visitor . Parents 60 excessively cry infants/infants colic recruit NHS health visitor . Infants include study healthy ( full-term ) age 1-7 week , diagnose excessive crying/infantile colic , co-morbidities . Participants randomise usual NHS care group usual NHS care plus cranial osteopathic intervention group . Usual NHS care provide health visitor osteopathic treatment carry experienced osteopath private practice . Primary outcome measure acceptability feasibility intervention procedure . Furthermore , change frequency duration cry document daily cry diary . Parental quality life also assess . This pilot investigation provide useful information order develop adapt current intervention trial procedure view full-scale randomise control trial .
